TopicTitle: RAPIERs won't ignite with Mk2 shock cone intakes

Articles.Content:
I'm attempting to build a simple SSTO for my first try at an SSTO. I watched several tutorials and thought I had a basic understanding of what I needed. So, I built this craft and was able to do a suborbital hop. I made a few changes to refine it closer to hitting orbit, but now my RAPIER engines will not ignite.

They're in air breathing mode on the runway, but when I activate them and throttle up, they immediately flame out and give an insufficient intake area error.

For whatever reason, the Mk2 Shock Cones will not provide air to them. I've tried swapping regular circular intakes, and regular circular shock cones to the exact position of the Mk2 shock cones and the RAPIERs work, but if I use other Mk2 shaped intakes, they do not work. Is there some reason that it's *just* the Mk2 form factor intakes that will not work?

 

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1180005913

Welcome to the forums. There are no such things as stock MK2 formfactor air intakes. So if you are finding them in some mod, then the ones in the mod are buggy. To build something resembling that with stock parts, you need to use an MK2 to MK1 adapter fuel tank, plus a regular circular shock cone.

Just tried it, and I can verify that works.

20 minutes ago, bewing said:

Welcome to the forums. There are no such things as stock MK2 formfactor air intakes. So if you are finding them in some mod, then the ones in the mod are buggy. To build something resembling that with stock parts, you need to use an MK2 to MK1 adapter fuel tank, plus a regular circular shock cone.

Just tried it, and I can verify that works.

 

Dang! I guess I should have played stock for awhile before adding mods. That explains why they worked before, but now don't. I guess they must just be buggy, like you said. Thank you for the reply.
